info.title: API Reference - Postcodes.io
info.description:
# Overview

Postcodes.io is a free postcode lookup API and geocoder for the UK.

## Endpoint

All services can be accessed from the following endpoint.

```
https://api.postcodes.io
```

The API accepts GET and POST requests. POST methods use content type `application/json`.

## Responses

JSON(P) only. CORS is enabled.

Each response comes with an appropriate HTTP Status code (except for JSONP requests). These include 200 for success, 400 for a bad request, 404 for not found and 500 for server error. The HTTP Status code is also included in the response body.

## Authentication

Postcodes.io does not require authentication.

externalDocs.description: More on our APIs, libraries with guides and examples

get.description:
### Postcode Data (Ordnance Survey Postcode Directory Dataset)

Data points returned by the /postcodes and /outcodes API

Note: Some fields may be null if not applicable or populated. These fields return type is specified as type|null

Query for a postcode either by:

- The postcode itself (with `postcode=`) or by,
- A geolocation (`lat=` and `lon=`).

## Query with Postcode

Submit a postcode query and receive a complete list of postcode matches and all associated postcode data. This is triggered when `query=` is supplied.

This is essentially a postcode search which prefix matches and returns postcodes in sorted order (case insensitive)

This method is space sensitive, i.e. it detects for spaces between outward and inward parts of the postcode (some examples detailed in this [issue](https://github.com/ideal-postcodes/postcodes.io/issues/44))

The result set can either be empty or populated with up to 100 postcode entities. Either way it will always return a 200 response code

## Query with Geolocation

Returns nearest postcodes for a given longitude and latitude. This is triggered when `lat=` and `lon=` is supplied.

schema.description: PLimits number of postcodes matches to return. Defaults to 10. Needs to be less than 100.

schema.title: Longitude
schema.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the east-west position of a point

schema.title: Latitude
schema.description: Geographic coordinate that specifies the north-south position of a point

schema.title: Radius
schema.description: Limits number of postcodes matches to return. Defaults to 100m. Needs to be less than 2,000m.

schema.title: Widesearch
schema.description: Search up to 20km radius, but subject to a maximum of 10 results. Since lookups over a wide area can be very expensive, we've created this method to allow you choose to make the trade off between search radius and number of results. Defaults to false. When enabled, radius and limits over 10 are ignored.

schema.title: Filter
schema.description: A comma separated whitelist of attributes to be returned in the result object(s), e.g. filter=postcode,longitude,latitude. null responses will continue to return null. If no attributes match the result object, an empty object is returned

post.description:
Accepts a JSON object containing an array of postcodes. Returns a list of matching postcodes and respective available data.

Be sure to submit JSON requests setting `Content-Type` to `application/json`

Accepts up to 100 postcodes.

### Post Data

This method requires a JSON object containing an array of postcodes to be posted, e.g.

```json
{
  "postcodes": ["PR3 0SG", "M45 6GN", "EX165BL"]
}
```

## Bulk Reverse Geocoding

Bulk translates geolocations into Postcodes. Accepts up to 100 geolocations.

get.description: Returns nearest postcodes for a given postcode.
Returns a random postcode and all available data for that postcode.

parameters.name: outcode
parameters.description: Filters random postcodes by outcode. Returns null if invalid outcode.

schema.title: Outward code
schema.description: Restrict results to a specific outward code

get.description:
Lookup a terminated postcode. 

If the terminated postcode exists, this API returns the date of termination and last known geospatial coordinates. 

Returns `404` if postcode does not exist in our database of terminated postcodes or not valid.

Source: Ordnance Survey Postcode Directory Dataset

Lookup a Scottish postcode. 

Returns Scottish Postcode Directory (SPD) data associated with postcode. At the moment this is just Scottish Parliamentary Constituency.

Returns `404` if postcode does not exist in SPD or is not valid.

For postcodes not in SPD but in ONSPD, 404 is returned with error message Postcode exists in ONSPD but not in SPD.

Source: Scottish Postcode Directory

parameters.name: postcode
parameters.description: Specifies the postcode you wish to query

get.description:
Returns aggregated information for postcodes grouped by their shared outward code.

The outward code is the first half of any postcode (3-4 characters and preceded by a space).

parameters.name: outcode
parameters.description: Specifies the outward code you wish to query.

get.description:
Submit a place query and receive a complete list of places matches and associated data.

This API uses the Ordnance Survey Open Names Dataset. Places not available for Northern Ireland.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Specifies the place you wish to query

get.description: Submit a place query and receive a complete list of places matches and associated data.
Returns a random place and all associated data

postcode.title: Postcode
postcode.description: All current ('live') postcodes within the United Kingdom, the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man, received monthly from Royal Mail. 2, 3 or 4-character outward code, single space and 3-character inward code.

outcode.title: Outward Code
outcode.description: The outward code is the part of the postcode before the single space in the middle. It is between two and four characters long. A few outward codes are non-geographic, not divulging where mail is to be sent.

incode.title: Inward Code
incode.description: The inward part is the part of the postcode after the single space in the middle. It is three characters long. The inward code assists in the delivery of post within a postal district.

quality.title: Positional Quality
quality.description:
Shows the status of the assigned grid reference.

1 = within the building of the matched address closest to the postcode mean

2 = as for status value 1, except by visual inspection of Landline maps (Scotland only)

3 = approximate to within 50m

4 = postcode unit mean (mean of matched addresses with the same postcode, but not snapped to a building)

5 = imputed by ONS, by reference to surrounding postcode grid references

6 = postcode sector mean, (mainly | PO Boxes)

8 = postcode terminated prior to Gridlink® initiative, last known ONS postcode grid reference1

9 = no grid reference available

eastings.title: Eastings
eastings.description: The Ordnance Survey postcode grid reference Easting to 1 metre resolution. Grid references for postcodes in Northern Ireland relate to the Irish Grid system. May be null if geolocation not available.

northings.title: Northings
northings.description: The Ordnance Survey postcode grid reference Northing to 1 metre resolution. Grid references for postcodes in Northern Ireland relate to the Irish Grid system. May be null if geolocation not available.

country.title: Country
country.description: The country (i.e. one of the four constituent countries of the United Kingdom or the Channel Islands or the Isle of Man) to which each postcode is assigned.

nhs_ha.title: Strategic Health Authority
nhs_ha.description: The health area code for the postcode.

admin_county.title: County
admin_county.description: The current county to which the postcode has been assigned.

admin_district.title: District
admin_district.description: The current district/unitary authority to which the postcode has been assigned.

admin_ward.title: Ward
admin_ward.description: The current administrative/electoral area to which the postcode has been assigned.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The WGS84 longitude given the Postcode's national grid reference. May be null if geolocation not available.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The WGS84 latitude given the Postcode's national grid reference. May be null if geolocation not available.

parliamentary_constituency.title: Westminster Parliamentary Constituency
parliamentary_constituency.description: The Westminster Parliamentary Constituency code for each postcode.

european_electoral_region.title: European Electoral Region (EER)
european_electoral_region.description: The European Electoral Region code for each postcode.

primary_care_trust.title: Primary Care Trust (PCT)
primary_care_trust.description: The code for the Primary Care areas in England, LHBs in Wales, CHPs in Scotland, LCG in Northern Ireland and PHD in the Isle of Man; there are no equivalent areas in the Channel Islands. Care Trust/ Care Trust Plus (CT)/ local health board (LHB)/ community health partnership (CHP)/ local commissioning group (LCG)/ primary healthcare directorate (PHD).

region.title: Region (formerly GOR)
region.description: The Region code for each postcode. The nine GORs were abolished on 1 April 2011 and are now known as ‘Regions’. They were the primary statistical subdivisions of England and also the areas in which the Government Offices for the Regions fulfilled their role. Each GOR covered a number of local authorities.

parish.title: Parish (England)/community (Wales)
parish.description: The smallest type of administrative area in England is the parish (also known as 'civil parish'); the equivalent units in Wales are communities.

lsoa.title: 2011 Census lower layer super output area (LSOA)
lsoa.description: The 2011 Census lower layer SOA code for England and Wales, SOA code for Northern Ireland and data zone code for Scotland.

msoa.title: 2011 Census middle layer super output area (MSOA)
msoa.description: The 2011 Census middle layer SOA (MSOA) code for England and Wales and intermediate zone for Scotland.

ced.title: County Electoral District
ced.description: The county electoral division code for each English postcode. Pseudo codes are included for the remainder of the UK. The field will be null for English postcodes with no grid reference. English county councils use county electoral divisions (CED) to elect councillors. These CEDs must be confined within district boundaries, but need not be based on whole electoral wards. The only exceptions are the Isles of Scilly and the Greater London Authority (GLA). CEDs do not exist within UAs.

ccg.title: Clinical Commissioning Group
ccg.description: Clinical commissioning groups (CCGs) are NHS organisations set up by the Health and Social Care Act 2012 to organise the delivery of NHS services in England.

nuts.title: International Terratorial Levels (ITL) (Former Nomenclature of Units for Territorial Statistics (NUTS)
nuts.description:
The national LAU1-equivalent code for each postcode. Pseudo codes are included for Channel Islands and Isle of Man. The field will otherwise be blank for postcodes with no grid reference.

As of May 2021. NUTS has changed to International Territorial Levels (ITL). Postcodes.io will report ITL in nuts and codes.nuts to preserve backwards compatibility.

Following the UK's withdrawal from the EU, a new UK-managed international statistical geography - ITL (International Territorial Levels) - was introduced from 1st January 2021, replacing the former NUTS classification. They align with international standards, enabling comparability both over time and internationally. To ensure continued alignment, the ITLs mirror the NUTS system. They also follow a similar review timetable, every three years.

NUTS is a hierarchical classification of spatial units that provides a breakdown of the European Union's territory for producing regional statistics that are comparable across the Union.

The ITL area classification in the UK comprises current national administrative and electoral areas, except in Scotland where some ITL areas comprise whole and/or part Local Enterprise Regions.

The ONSPD contains the LAU1 code (9-character LAD/UA code for England, Wales and Northern Ireland and 'S30' code for Scotland). A comprehensive lookup of LAU and ITL codes is included with the accompanying metadata.

codes.title: Returns an ID or Code associated with the postcode
codes.description: Typically, these are a 9 character code known as an ONS Code or GSS Code. This is currently only available for districts, parishes, counties, CCGs, NUTS and wards.

nuts.description: The ITL code associated with the postcode.

lau2.title: LAU2
lau2.description: The LAU2 code associated with the postcode.

NearestPostcode.title: Geolocated Postcode
NearestPostcode.description: Standard postcode object extended with a distance attribute, indicating how far the postcode is from a supplied geolocation.

distance.title: Distance from supplied geolocation
distance.description: Distance in metres from specified postcode

postcode.title: Postcode
postcode.description: All currently terminated postcodes within the United Kingdom, the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man, received every 3 months from Royal Mail. 2, 3 or 4-character outward code, single space and 3-character inward code.

month_terminated.title: Termination month
month_terminated.description: Month of termination of a postcode. 1-January, 2-February ... 12-December.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The WGS84 longitude given the Postcode's national grid reference.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The WGS84 latitude given the Postcode's national grid reference.

codes.title: Returns an ID or Code associated with the postcode
codes.description: Typically, these are a 9 character code known as an ONS Code or GSS Code.

scottish_parliamentary_constituency.title: Scottish Parliamentary Constituency GSS Code
scottish_parliamentary_constituency.description: A code that identifies a 2014 Scottish Parliamentary Constituency.

outcode.title: Outcode
outcode.description: The outcode or outward code is the part of the postcode before the single space in the middle. It is between two and four characters long. Examples of outward codes include "L1", "W1A", "RH1", "RH10" or "SE1P". A few outward codes are non-geographic, not divulging where mail is to be sent.

eastings.title: Eastings
eastings.description: The Ordnance Survey postcode grid reference Easting to 1 metre resolution; blank for postcodes in the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man. Grid references for postcodes in Northern Ireland relate to the Irish Grid system. Computed as the arithmetic mean of the input coordinates. Returns 0 if geolocation is not available.

northings.title: Northings
northings.description: The Ordnance Survey postcode grid reference Northing to 1 metre resolution; blank for postcodes in the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man. Grid references for postcodes in Northern Ireland relate to the Irish Grid system. Computed as the arithmetic mean of the input coordinates. Returns 0 if geolocation is not available.

admin_county.title: County
admin_county.description: The current counties under the outcode.

admin_district.title: District
admin_district.description: The current district/unitary authorites under the outcode.

admin_ward.title: Ward
admin_ward.description: The current administrative/electoral areas under the outcode.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The WGS84 longitude given the Postcode's national grid reference. Computed as the arithmetic mean of input coordinates. May be null if geolocation not available.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The WGS84 latitude given the Postcode's national grid reference. Computed as the arithmetic mean of input coordinates. May be null if geolocation not available.

country.title: Country
country.description: The countries included in the outcode.

parish.title: Parish (England)/community (Wales)
parish.description: The parishes included in the outcode.

code.title: Code
code.description: A unique identifier that enables records to be identified easily. The identifier will be persistent for all LocalTypes except Section of Named Road and Section of Numbered Road.

name_1.title: Name
name_1.description: The proper noun that applies to the real world entity. Names that are prefixed by the definite article are not formatted for alphabetical sorting, that is, 'The Pennines' not 'Pennines, The'.

name_1_lang.title: Language of Name
name_1_lang.description: The language type is only set where more than one name exists, e.g. cym (Welsh), eng (English), gla (Scottish Gaelic).

name_2.title: Name (in case of multiple languages)
name_2.description: The proper noun that applies to the real world entity. Names that are prefixed by the definite article are not formatted for alphabetical sorting, that is, 'The Pennines' not 'Pennines, The'.

name_2_lang.title: Language of Name
name_2_lang.description: The language type is only set where more than one name exists, e.g. cym (Welsh), eng (English), gla (Scottish Gaelic).

local_type.title: Local Type
local_type.description: The Ordnance Survey classification for the named place being represented by the specific feature, e.g. City, Town, Village, Hamlet, Other Settlement, Suburban Area.

county_unitary.title: Administrative Area
county_unitary.description: The name of the County (non-metropolitan or Metropolitan), Unitary Authority or Greater London Authority administrative area that the point geometry for feature is within or nearest to.

county_unitary_type.title: Administrative Area Type
county_unitary_type.description: Classifies the type of administrative unit.

district_borough.title: District or Borough
district_borough.description: The name of the District, Metropolitan District or London Borough administrative unit that the point geometry for the feature is within.

district_borough_type.title: Borough Type
district_borough_type.description: Classifies the type of administrative unit.

region.title: Region
region.description: The name of the European Region (was Government O ice Region) that the point geometry for the feature is within or nearest to.

country.title: Country
country.description: OS Places relates to Great Britain only. i.e. England, Scotland, Wales.

longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The WGS84 longitude given the Place's national grid reference.

latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The WGS84 latitude given the Place's national grid reference.

eastings.title: Eastings
eastings.description: The Ordnance Survey postcode grid reference Easting to 1 metre resolution; blank for postcodes in the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man.

northings.title: Northings
northings.description: The Ordnance Survey postcode grid reference Northing to 1 metre resolution; blank for postcodes in the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man.

min_eastings.title: Minimum Eastings
min_eastings.description: Bounding box or Minimum Bounding Rectangle (MBR) for roads and settlements. For Settlements and Sections of Named and Numbered Roads, the MBR gives a representation of the extent of these features and is not snapped to the real world extent.

min_northings.title: Minimum Northings
min_northings.description: Bounding box or Minimum Bounding Rectangle (MBR) for roads and settlements. For Settlements and Sections of Named and Numbered Roads, the MBR gives a representation of the extent of these features and is not snapped to the real world extent.

max_eastings.title: Maximum Eastings
max_eastings.description: Bounding box or Minimum Bounding Rectangle (MBR) for roads and settlements. For Settlements and Sections of Named and Numbered Roads, the MBR gives a representation of the extent of these features and is not snapped to the real world extent.

max_northings.title: Maximum Northings
max_northings.description: Bounding box or Minimum Bounding Rectangle (MBR) for roads and settlements. For Settlements and Sections of Named and Numbered Roads, the MBR gives a representation of the extent of these features and is not snapped to the real world extent.
